# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code to solve this task:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width=10)
    words = split(input_string, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(line) > text_width
            result *= "\n$line"
            line = word
        else
            if !isempty(line) 
                line *= " "
            end
            line *= word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(line)
        result *= "\n$line"
    end
    
    return result
end
```

Example:
```julia
print(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")) 
```
Output:
```
This function will
wrap words into
lines
```
